DOC.brief_title: Positive End Expiratory Pressure With A T-piece Resuscitator For Near-Term Term Infants With Respiratory Distress
DOC.detailed_description: The aim study determine whether positive end expiratory pressure therapy ( PEEP ) administer early via T piece base infant resuscitator ( Neopuff ) would safely reduce incidence TTN need neonatal intensive care unit ( NICU ) admission near term term infant respiratory distress .
DOC.criteria: Near term infant ( 3637 week gestational age ) Full term infant ( 3841 week gestational age ) . Presence sign respiratory distress ( Tachypnea , intercostal subcostal retraction , nasal flare grunt ) evident shortly birth . Cesarean section ( CS ) define elective surgery perform onset labor , case define secondary CS . Presence risk factor neonatal sepsis Prolonged Rupture Membranes â‰¥48 hour ( PROM ) , maternal fever , maternal chorioamnionitis positive maternal GBS colonization . Presence cause respiratory distress , eg . congenital malformation affect cardiorespiratory system , chromosomal aberration , depression birth ( Apgar score 5 minute < 7 umbilical artery pH < 7.10 ) , fetal hydrops , persistent pulmonary hypertension , meconium aspiration syndrome .
